messages.text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood.
messages.author: Marie Curie

messages.text: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
messages.author: Carl Sagan

messages.text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.text: The important thing is not to stop questioning.
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.text: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
messages.author: Carl Sagan

messages.text: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him.
messages.author: Edwin Hubble

messages.text: An experiment is a question which science poses to nature.
messages.author: Max Planck

messages.text: What we observe is not nature itself, but nature exposed to our method of questioning.
messages.author: Werner Heisenberg

messages.text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
messages.author: Isaac Asimov

messages.text: Science is organized knowledge.
messages.author: Herbert Spencer

messages.text: If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
messages.author: Isaac Newton

messages.text: Pure mathematics is, in its way, the poetry of logical ideas.
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.text: Mathematics knows no races or geographic boundaries.
messages.author: David Hilbert

messages.text: In mathematics the art of proposing a question must be held of higher value than solving it.
messages.author: Georg Cantor

messages.text: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
messages.author: Dennis Ritchie

messages.text: Programs must be written for people to read.
messages.author: Harold Abelson

messages.text: Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability.
messages.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

messages.text: Testing shows the presence, not the absence, of bugs.
messages.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

messages.text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear simple.
messages.author: Grady Booch

messages.text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
messages.author: Linus Torvalds

messages.text: Science and everyday life cannot and should not be separated.
messages.author: Rosalind Franklin

messages.text: I was taught that the way of progress is neither swift nor easy.
messages.author: Marie Curie

messages.text: The universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.
messages.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

messages.text: Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence.
messages.author: Carl Sagan

messages.text: In questions of science, the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.
messages.author: Galileo Galilei

messages.text: Nature uses only the longest threads to weave her patterns.
messages.author: Richard Feynman

messages.text: Physics is like sex. Sure, it may give some practical results, but that’s not why we do it.
messages.author: Richard Feynman

messages.text: What I cannot create, I do not understand.
messages.author: Richard Feynman

messages.text: A good theory explains a lot with little.
messages.author: Stephen Hawking

messages.text: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
messages.author: Stephen Hawking

messages.text: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity.
messages.author: Louis Pasteur

messages.text: Chance favors the prepared mind.
messages.author: Louis Pasteur

messages.text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
messages.author: Alan Kay

messages.text: The purpose of computing is insight, not numbers.
messages.author: Richard Hamming

messages.text: The most dangerous phrase in the language is, ‘We’ve always done it this way.’
messages.author: Grace Hopper

messages.text: One accurate measurement is worth a thousand expert opinions.
messages.author: Grace Hopper

messages.text: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
messages.author: Bill Gates

messages.text: Engineering is the art of directing the great sources of power in nature.
messages.author: Thomas Tredgold

messages.text: The scientist is not a person who gives the right answers, but one who asks the right questions.
messages.author: Claude Lévi-Strauss

messages.text: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
messages.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

messages.text: Mathematics is the language with which God has written the universe.
messages.author: Galileo Galilei

messages.text: The essence of mathematics is freedom.
messages.author: Georg Cantor

messages.text: An equation has meaning only if it expresses a law of nature.
messages.author: Paul Dirac

messages.text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
messages.author: Steve Jobs

messages.text: Technology is nothing. What’s important is that you have faith in people.
messages.author: Steve Jobs

messages.text: The goal of science is to build better explanations.
messages.author: David Deutsch

messages.text: Prediction is very difficult, especially if it’s about the future.
messages.author: Niels Bohr

messages.text: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
messages.author: Stephen Hawking

messages.text: We are made of star stuff.
messages.author: Carl Sagan

messages.text: Astronomy compels the soul to look upward.
messages.author: Ptolemy

messages.text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
messages.author: Arthur C. Clarke

messages.text: We do not know one millionth of one percent about anything.
messages.author: Thomas Edison

messages.text: Failure is success in progress.
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.text: In science there is only physics; all the rest is stamp collecting.
messages.author: Ernest Rutherford

messages.text: The computer is incredibly fast, accurate, and stupid.
messages.author: John Pfeiffer

messages.text: Make everything as simple as possible, but not simpler.
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.text: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
messages.author: Thomas Edison

messages.text: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.
messages.author: Edward Teller

messages.text: Software is a great combination between artistry and engineering.
messages.author: Bill Gates

messages.text: Everything is theoretically impossible until it is done.
messages.author: Robert A. Heinlein

messages.text: The good thing about science is that it’s true whether or not you believe in it.
messages.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

messages.text: Mathematics is not about numbers, equations, or algorithms: it is about understanding.
messages.author: William Thurston

messages.text: Science is what we understand well enough to explain to a computer.
messages.author: Donald Knuth

messages.text: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
messages.author: Donald Knuth

messages.text: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
messages.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

messages.text: The purpose of models is not to be right but to be useful.
messages.author: George Box

messages.text: To understand is to invent.
messages.author: Jean Piaget

messages.text: Every problem has a solution which is neat, plausible, and wrong.
messages.author: H. L. Mencken

messages.text: Research is what I’m doing when I don’t know what I’m doing.
messages.author: Wernher von Braun

messages.text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.text: Engineering is not only study of 45 subjects but moral studies of intellectual life.
messages.author: Prakhar Srivastav

messages.text: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men.
messages.author: Elbert Hubbard

messages.text: A computer once beat me at chess, but it was no match for me at kickboxing.
messages.author: Garry Kasparov

messages.text: The art of programming is the art of organizing complexity.
messages.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

messages.text: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.
messages.author: Adam Smith

messages.text: The true delight is in the finding out rather than in the knowing.
messages.author: Isaac Asimov

messages.text: A ship in port is safe, but that’s not what ships are built for.
messages.author: Grace Hopper

messages.text: The advance of technology is based on making it fit in so that you don’t notice it.
messages.author: Bill Gates

messages.text: We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.
messages.author: Alan Turing

messages.text: Those who can imagine anything, can create the impossible.
messages.author: Alan Turing

messages.text: If people do not believe that mathematics is simple, it is only because they do not realize how complicated life is.
messages.author: John von Neumann

messages.text: In mathematics you don’t understand things. You just get used to them.
messages.author: John von Neumann

messages.text: Innovation requires willingness to see things differently.
messages.author: Nikola Tesla

messages.text: The present is theirs; the future, for which I really worked, is mine.
messages.author: Nikola Tesla

messages.text: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
messages.author: Vincent van Gogh

messages.text: Engineering problems are under-defined, there are many solutions.
messages.author: Bruce Eisenhower

messages.text: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
messages.author: Steve Jobs

messages.text: Mathematics is the most beautiful and most powerful creation of the human spirit.
messages.author: Stefan Banach

messages.text: To raise new questions, new possibilities, requires creative imagination.
messages.author: Albert Einstein

messages.text: The scientist discovers a new type of ignorance.
messages.author: Philip Morrison

messages.text: Engineering is the art of making what you want from things you can get.
messages.author: Unknown engineer maxim

messages.text: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve.
messages.author: Patrick McKenzie

messages.text: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
messages.author: Thomas Fuchs

messages.text: The essence of engineering is compromise.
messages.author: Unknown

messages.text: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
messages.author: African proverb

messages.text: We shape our tools and thereafter our tools shape us.
messages.author: Marshall McLuhan

messages.text: The computer is a bicycle for the mind.
messages.author: Steve Jobs

messages.text: Mathematics is the key and door to the sciences.
messages.author: Roger Bacon

messages.text: The joy of discovery is the liveliest that the mind of man can ever feel.
messages.author: Claude Bernard

messages.text: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
messages.author: Albert Einstein
